intro: Plagianthus cymosus, commonly known as the African flame plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and orange tubular flowers that bloom in dense clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while the stems are woody and often branched. Plagianthus cymosus is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
